subproject.corporate outcome: Legislatures, regional elected bodies, and local assemblies have strengthened institutional capacity, enabling them to represent their constituents more effectively
subproject.description:
Consolidation of Democracy and Good Governance in Lesotho (CDGG) is a four-year programme jointly funded by Irish Aid and  the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP). It is  designed to build on the recently ended  multi-donor project " Deepening Democracy "   and aims to deepen democracy and good governance through improved electoral processes, effective functioning of parliament  and enhanced promotion of human rights. 

Specifically, the CDGG will provide support to: (1) electoral reforms to ensure that elections add value to democratic governance and political stability; (2) parliamentary reforms to improve the effectiveness of the legislature in its three-pronged mandate of law-making, representation and oversight; and (3) the promotion and protection of human rights in accordance with the principles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. To achieve its primary goals and objectives, the CDGG has identified, albeit not limited to, the following key institutions as enabling partners: The Independent Electoral Commission (IEC), Parliament, Ministry of Justice, Human Rights and Correctional Services and the Office of   the Ombudsman.
subproject.title: CDGG-IEC

subproject.corporate outcome: Legislatures, regional elected bodies, and local assemblies have strengthened institutional capacity, enabling them to represent their constituents more effectively
